HP 4192A device module¶

class hp4192a.HP4192A(gpib='Auto')[source]¶

Bases: object

Class representing the HP 4192A GPIB device object.

Methods

__init__:

Method called when class is initialized.

isConnected:

Method that returns the connected boolean of the class.

closeConnection:

Method called to close the connection to the device.

sendCommandString:

Method called to generate and send a command string to the HP 4192A device.

readFromInstrument:

Method used to read data from the HP 4192A device.
AVERAGE = ['V0', 'V1']¶

Average data.

V0 : OFF V1 : ON Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information. https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf

BIAS = ['BI', 'TB', 'PB']¶

Measurement bias.

BI : SPOT BIAS TB : START BIAS PB : STOP BIAS Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information. https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf

CIRCUIT_MODE = ['C1', 'C2', 'C3']¶

String constants for circuit mode.

C1 : Auto C2 : Series C3 : Parallel Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information. https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf

DATA_READY = ['D0', 'D1']¶

Data ready command.

D0 : OFF D1 : ON Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information. https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf

EXECUTE = ['EX']¶

Command code to trigger the instrument.

Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information. https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf

FREQUENCY_SETT = ['FR', 'TF', 'PF']¶

Frequency setting.

FR : SPOT FREQ TF : START FREQ PF : STOP FREQ Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information. https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf

FUNCTION_A = ['A1', 'A2', 'A3', 'A4']¶

String constants for Function A.

A1 : Z/Y A2 : R/G A3 : L A4 : C Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information. https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf

FUNCTION_B = ['B1', 'B2', 'B3']¶

String constants for Function B.

B1 : DEG Q B2 : RAD D B3 : R/G Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information. https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf

HIGH_SPEED = ['H0', 'H1']¶

High Speed.

H0 is OFF. H1 is ON. Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information. https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf

OP_DATA_FORMAT = ['F0', 'F1']¶

Output data format.

F0 : Displays A/B F1 : Displays A/B/C Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information. https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf

TRIGGER = ['T1', 'T2', 'T3']¶

Trigger mode for the instrument.

T1 is internal. Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information. https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf

ZY_RANGE = ['R1', 'R2', 'R3', 'R4', 'R5', 'R6', 'R7', 'R8']¶

Range level.

R8 is AUTO Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information. https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf

sendCommandString(data_ready: int | None = None, zy_range: int | None = None, high_speed: int | None = None, average: int | None = None, output_format: int | None = None, function_A: int | None = None, function_B: int | None = None, circuit_mode: int | None = None, trigger: int | None = None, osc_level: float | None = None, test_signal_freq: float | None = None, dc_bias: bool = True, bias_setting: float | None = None, execute: bool = False, sleep_adder: int = 100) → None[source]¶

Method called to generate and send a command string to the HP 4192A device.

Parameters:
data_readyint | None, optional

Index for the DATA_READY parameter, by default None

zy_rangeint | None, optional

Index for the Z/Y range level parameter, by default None

averageint | None, optional

Index for the averaging parameter, by default None

output_formatint | None, optional

Index for the output format parameter, by default None

function_Aint | None, optional

Index for the Function A parameter, by default None

function_Bint | None, optional

Index for the Function B parameter, by default None

circuit_modeint | None, optional

Index for the circuit mode parameter, by default None

triggerint | None, optional

Index for the trigger mode parameter, by default None

osc_levelfloat | None, optional

Value for the oscillation level of the test frequency signal, by default None

test_signal_freqfloat | None, optional

Value for the frequency of the test signal, by default None

dc_biasbool, optional

Boolean indicating if DC Bias is ON, by default True

bias_settingfloat | None, optional

Value for the DC Bias if set to ON, by default None

executebool, optional

Boolean indicating if the execute command is to be added to the commands., by default False.

sleep_adderint, optional

Integer with the sleep to be added per command in ms.

Source Code¶

  1import math
  2import re
  3import pyvisa
  4import time
  5
  6
  7class HP4192A:
  8    """Class representing the HP 4192A GPIB device object.
  9
 10    Methods
 11    -------
 12    __init__:
 13        Method called when class is initialized.
 14    isConnected:
 15        Method that returns the connected boolean of the class.
 16    closeConnection:
 17        Method called to close the connection to the device.
 18    sendCommandString:
 19        Method called to generate and send a command string to the HP 4192A device.
 20    readFromInstrument:
 21        Method used to read data from the HP 4192A device.
 22
 23    """
 24
 25    FUNCTION_A = [f"A{i}" for i in range(1, 5)]
 26    """String constants for Function A.
 27    
 28    A1 : Z/Y
 29    A2 : R/G
 30    A3 : L
 31    A4 : C
 32    Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information.
 33    https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf
 34    """
 35    FUNCTION_B = [f"B{i}" for i in range(1, 4)]
 36    """String constants for Function B.
 37
 38    B1 : DEG Q
 39    B2 : RAD D
 40    B3 : R/G
 41    Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information.
 42    https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf
 43    """
 44    CIRCUIT_MODE = [f"C{i}" for i in range(1, 4)]
 45    """String constants for circuit mode.
 46    
 47    C1 : Auto
 48    C2 : Series
 49    C3 : Parallel
 50    Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information.
 51    https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf
 52    """
 53    DATA_READY = ["D0", "D1"]
 54    """Data ready command.
 55
 56    D0 : OFF
 57    D1 : ON
 58    Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information.
 59    https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf
 60    """
 61    ZY_RANGE = [f"R{i}" for i in range(1, 9)]
 62    """Range level.
 63
 64    R8 is AUTO
 65    Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information.
 66    https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf
 67    """
 68
 69    HIGH_SPEED = ["H0", "H1"]
 70    """High Speed.
 71
 72    H0 is OFF. H1 is ON.
 73    Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information.
 74    https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf
 75    """
 76
 77    TRIGGER = [f"T{i}" for i in range(1, 4)]
 78    """Trigger mode for the instrument.
 79
 80    T1 is internal.
 81    Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information.
 82    https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf
 83    """
 84    OP_DATA_FORMAT = ["F0", "F1"]
 85    """Output data format.
 86    
 87    F0 : Displays A/B
 88    F1 : Displays A/B/C
 89    Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information.
 90    https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf
 91    """
 92    EXECUTE = ["EX"]
 93    """Command code to trigger the instrument.
 94
 95    Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information.
 96    https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf
 97    """
 98    AVERAGE = ["V0", "V1"]
 99    """Average data.
100    
101    V0 : OFF
102    V1 : ON
103    Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information.
104    https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf
105    """
106    BIAS = ["BI", "TB", "PB"]
107    """Measurement bias.
108    
109    BI : SPOT BIAS
110    TB : START BIAS
111    PB : STOP BIAS
112    Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information.
113    https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf
114    """
115
116    FREQUENCY_SETT = ["FR", "TF", "PF"]
117    """Frequency setting.
118    
119    FR : SPOT FREQ
120    TF : START FREQ
121    PF : STOP FREQ
122    Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information.
123    https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf
124    """
125
126    __rm: pyvisa.ResourceManager
127    """VISA resource manager"""
128
129    ___gpib_address: str
130    """The GPIB address of the device."""
131
132    __hp_4192a: pyvisa.resources.Resource
133    """The HP 4192A at the GPIB address."""
134
135    __device_connected: bool = False
136    """Boolean indicating if the device connection was succesful."""
137
138    current_range: str = ""
139    """Current range deduced from the raw string received from the HP 4192A."""
140
141    def __init__(self, gpib="Auto") -> None:
142        """Method called when class is initialized.
143
144        Parameters
145        ----------
146        gpib : str, optional
147            The GPIB address of the device, by default "Auto"
148        """
149        self.__rm = pyvisa.ResourceManager()
150
151        if gpib in "Auto":
152            for address in self.__rm.list_resources():
153                if "GPIB" in address:
154                    self.__gpib_address = address
155                    break
156        else:
157            if gpib in self.__rm.list_resources():
158                self.__gpib_address = gpib
159            else:
160                print("Entered GPIB address does not exist.")
161                return
162
163        try:
164            self.__hp_4192a = self.__rm.open_resource(self.__gpib_address)
165            self.__hp_4192a.timeout = None
166            self.__hp_4192a.read_termination = "\r\n"
167            """Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information.
168            https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf"""
169            self.__device_connected = True
170        except Exception as e:
171            print(e)
172        pass
173
174    def isConnected(self) -> bool:
175        """Method that returns the connected boolean of the class.
176
177        Returns
178        -------
179        bool
180            Boolean with the connection status of the device.
181        """
182        return self.__device_connected
183
184    def closeConnection(self) -> None:
185        """Method called to close the connection to the device."""
186        if self.__device_connected:
187            self.__hp_4192a.close()
188            self.__rm.close()
189
190    def sendCommandString(
191        self,
192        data_ready: int | None = None,
193        zy_range: int | None = None,
194        high_speed: int | None = None,
195        average: int | None = None,
196        output_format: int | None = None,
197        function_A: int | None = None,
198        function_B: int | None = None,
199        circuit_mode: int | None = None,
200        trigger: int | None = None,
201        osc_level: float | None = None,
202        test_signal_freq: float | None = None,
203        dc_bias: bool = True,
204        bias_setting: float | None = None,
205        execute: bool = False,
206        sleep_adder: int = 100,
207    ) -> None:
208        """Method called to generate and send a command string to the HP 4192A device.
209
210        Parameters
211        ----------
212        data_ready : int | None, optional
213            Index for the DATA_READY parameter, by default None
214        zy_range : int | None, optional
215            Index for the Z/Y range level parameter, by default None
216        average : int | None, optional
217            Index for the averaging parameter, by default None
218        output_format : int | None, optional
219            Index for the output format parameter, by default None
220        function_A : int | None, optional
221            Index for the Function A parameter, by default None
222        function_B : int | None, optional
223            Index for the Function B parameter, by default None
224        circuit_mode : int | None, optional
225            Index for the circuit mode parameter, by default None
226        trigger : int | None, optional
227            Index for the trigger mode parameter, by default None
228        osc_level : float | None, optional
229            Value for the oscillation level of the test frequency signal, by default None
230        test_signal_freq : float | None, optional
231            Value for the frequency of the test signal, by default None
232        dc_bias : bool, optional
233            Boolean indicating if DC Bias is ON, by default True
234        bias_setting : float | None, optional
235            Value for the DC Bias if set to ON, by default None
236        execute : bool, optional
237            Boolean indicating if the execute command is to be added to the commands., by default False.
238        sleep_adder : int, optional
239            Integer with the sleep to be added per command in ms.
240        """
241        if self.__device_connected:
242            sleeptime = 0
243            sleep_adder = sleep_adder
244            command_string = ""
245            if data_ready is not None:
246                command_string = "".join([command_string, self.DATA_READY[data_ready]])
247                sleeptime += sleep_adder
248            if zy_range is not None:
249                command_string = "".join([command_string, self.ZY_RANGE[zy_range]])
250                sleeptime += sleep_adder
251            if high_speed is not None:
252                command_string = "".join([command_string, self.HIGH_SPEED[high_speed]])
253                sleeptime += sleep_adder
254            if average is not None:
255                command_string = "".join([command_string, self.AVERAGE[average]])
256                sleeptime += sleep_adder
257            if output_format is not None:
258                command_string = "".join([command_string, self.OP_DATA_FORMAT[output_format]])
259                sleeptime += sleep_adder
260            if function_A is not None:
261                command_string = "".join([command_string, self.FUNCTION_A[function_A]])
262                sleeptime += sleep_adder
263            if function_B is not None:
264                command_string = "".join([command_string, self.FUNCTION_B[function_B]])
265                sleeptime += sleep_adder
266            if circuit_mode is not None:
267                command_string = "".join([command_string, self.CIRCUIT_MODE[circuit_mode]])
268                sleeptime += sleep_adder
269            if trigger is not None:
270                command_string = "".join([command_string, self.TRIGGER[trigger]])
271                sleeptime += sleep_adder
272            if osc_level is not None:
273                command_string = "".join([command_string, f"OL{osc_level:.3f}EN"])
274                sleeptime += sleep_adder
275            if test_signal_freq is not None:
276                freq_kHz = test_signal_freq / 1000
277                freq_cmd: str
278                if freq_kHz < 10.0:
279                    freq_cmd = f"{(freq_kHz):09.6f}"
280                elif freq_kHz < 100.0:
281                    freq_cmd = f"{(freq_kHz):09.5f}"
282                elif freq_kHz < 1000.0:
283                    freq_cmd = f"{(freq_kHz):09.4f}"
284                else:
285                    freq_cmd = f"{(freq_kHz):09.3f}"
286                command_string = "".join([command_string, f"FR{freq_cmd}EN"])
287                sleeptime += sleep_adder
288            if dc_bias:
289                if bias_setting is not None:
290                    command_string = "".join([command_string, f"BI{bias_setting:.2f}EN"])
291                    sleeptime += sleep_adder
292            else:
293                command_string = "".join([command_string, "I0"])  # Refer to HP 4192A manual for more information.
294                # https://www.keysight.com/us/en/assets/9018-05094/user-manuals/9018-05094.pdf
295                sleeptime += sleep_adder
296            if execute:
297                command_string = "".join([command_string, "EX"])
298                sleeptime += sleep_adder
299
300            self.__hp_4192a.write(command_string)
301            time.sleep(sleeptime / 1000)
302
303    def readFromInstrument(self) -> list:
304        """Method used to read data from the HP 4192A device.
305
306        Returns
307        -------
308        list
309            list of float values corresponding to display A and display B of the device.
310        """
311        if self.__device_connected:
312            received_string = self.__hp_4192a.read()
313
314            # Regular expression to capture floating numbers in scientific notation
315            pattern = r"[-+]?\d*\.\d+E[-+]?\d+"
316
317            # Find all matches
318            matches = re.findall(pattern, received_string)
319
320            # Convert matches to floats
321            float_numbers = [float(match) for match in matches]
322            return float_numbers
323        else:
324            return [math.nan, math.nan]
